titleInfo.title: The Dramatic Club, Hume-Fogg Yearbook, "The Echo" Nashville, Tennessee, 1923

location.physicalLocation: Metropolitan Nashville/Davidson County Archives, Nashville Public Library

mods.abstract: Student members of the Hume Fogg Dramatic Club, pictured in the 1923 yearbook known as “The Echo.” The Hume-Fogg High School is a public high school located at 700 Broadway in Nashville, Tennessee. In 1912 Hume High School and Fogg High School merged into Hume-Fogg at the school's current site on Broadway. The building was constructed in the Tudor Revival style by architects William B. Ittner and Robert Sharp. In 1942 Hume-Fogg was recast as a Technical and Vocational School. In 1982 it was restructured to serve as an academic magnet school for Nashville's gifted and talented students. Hume-Fogg was added to the National Registry of Historic Places in 1974. Forms part of the Hume-Fogg High School Yearbook Collection. 1 yearbook.
